attributes.action: Consider giving Theoretical Physicist Stephen Hawking a state funeral
attributes.additional_details:
Over the years he has contributed a substantial amount to science despite his decades-long health concerns, primarily amyotrophic lateral sclerosis which was first diagnosed when he was 21 years old.
We feel it is only appropriate to acknowledge that lifelong service to the progression of science and inspiring millions of people to pursue a life in S.T.E.M fields by marking the passing of his life with a state funeral.
For more information:
https://arstechnica.com/science/2018/03/stephen-hawking-legendary-theoretical-physicist-dies-at-76/
https://arstechnica.com/science/2016/08/model-black-hole-generates-hawking-radiation/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_Hawking
attributes.background: Stephen Hawking, Discoverer of the Hawking radiation equation recently passed away in his sleep.

rejection.details:
The Government and the House of Commons do not have the power to decide that someone should receive a state funeral. You can find out more about this here:

http://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN06600

You could start a new petition asking the House of Commons to ask the Queen for a state funeral to be given, and for the House of Commons to provide the money for a state funeral.
